Title: We were told that he was killed, but we still hold on to the hop...

Title: Israeli university suspends lecturer who said IDF soldiers 'murde...

Title: Israeli university suspends lecturer who called IDF soldiers 'bab...

Title: Weeks later, no one can explain why Israeli troops killed yet ano...
Description: While standing by chance near a kindergarten run by Save the Children in the West Bank village of Sebastia, Ahmad Jazar, 15, was shot to death by an Israeli soldier. 'Since the war in Gaza started,' says the head of the local council, 'there's nothing easier for Israelis than to shoot Palestinians'

Title: Families of hostages whose bodies remain in Gaza captivity demand...

'This kind of burial is closure for the government, not for us, she said, adding that the family 'rejected the proposal outright'

Title: Why Hamas sees U.S. hostage talks as an indirect path to politica...

Title: In Iran, like in Gaza, Trump wields a sledgehammer but lacks a so...

Title: It was important to me that he knew we hadn't forgotten him'
Description: Yaki Teka, childhood friend of Abera Mengistu who was freed last month from Hamas captivity after more than a decade, tells Haaretz of their long awaited reunion. 'At night, before falling asleep, I'd think about him and ask myself: 'I'm lying here in bed but where is he sleeping? What is he eating?'

Description: Omer was released after 505 days in Hamas captivity, his father, Malki says that his son suffered from anxiety and depression in captivity, but 'did not let himself break'. Omer flew with his mother and other released hostages to meet U.S. President Donald Trump. 'He didn't think twice,' says Malki. 'He immediately said, 'I'll do everything I have to do''

Title: IDF's Kfar Azza investigation: Terrorists massacred residents for...
Description: Kibbutz residents were killed in their homes despite IDF soldiers reaching them and promising to return, but were caught in battle before fulfilling those promises. Evacuations occurred while passing fallen bodies, and in some cases, under terrorist fire

Title: Netanyahu downplays meetings and relationship with media mogul at...

Title: IDF Investigation: How Hamas captured Nahal Oz army base on Octob...
Description: The investigation, published on Monday, reveals that the fall of Nahal Oz was directly linked to the disregard and negligence of orders by the entire IDF command chain, which led to the failure to safeguard the base. 'This is a severe systemic failure,' said the senior IDF commander who conducted the probe

Title: Car plows into crowd in Mannheim, killing two, amid recent violen...
Description: The suspect is reportedly a 40-year-old German man. Security has been a concern in Germany following recent violent attacks, including deadly car rammings in Magdeburg and Munich in recent months

Title: Dore Gold, Israeli diplomat and adviser to Netanyahu, dies at 71
Description: Gold, born in the United States, served as Israel's ambassador to the UN and headed its Foreign Ministry under Netanyahu's governments. In later years, he led a right-wing think tank

Title: Indescribable suffering': The man exposing the horrors of Haredi...

Title: I thought there was nothing worse than a father burying a son, b...
Description: A few days before October 7, 2023, hostage Yosef Chaim Ohana and his father celebrated Sukkot. 'I put my hand on his head and said, 'God will save you from death and torment.' We hugged and I haven't seen him since,'

Title: Israel and Hamas can reach agreement with intensive mediator invo...
Description: Qatar and the U.S. are working to bridge gaps between Israel and Hamas and push for the cease-fire's second stage. Meanwhile, Egypt and the Palestinian Authority are drafting a Gaza rehabilitation plan, with Hamas' control a key dispute

Title: Netanyahu knew the hostages were tortured by Hamas and stayed si...
Description: A father whose son's body is held in Gaza called for Netanyahu to prioritize hostages over military gains: 'When someone causes a living person to die for political gain – it's murder.' Freed hostage Sasha Troufanov, in a video shown at a protest, urged: 'Don't let revenge outweigh life's sanctity, fight until everyone is home'

Title: Hamas releases video of freed hostage Iair Horn parting from his ...
Description: Iair and Eitan Horn, held by Hamas, are seen with released hostage Sagui Dekel Chen and others. Eitan, crying, said, 'I'm happy my brother is being released, but it doesn't make sense to separate families'

Title: Freed hostage Eli Sharabi recounts starvation and torture in Hama...
Description: Released last month from Hamas captivity, Eli Sharabi told Israeli TV that military operations can't rescue hostages and described captivity's harrowing conditions: 'We survived on 250–300 calories a day for months.' He also said Israel's treatment of Palestinian prisoners influenced Hamas' torture tactics

Title: Freed hostage says Israel's treatment of Palestinian prisoners in...
Description: Eli Sharabi, who was released from Hamas captivity last month, told Israeli TV that it's impossible to rescue hostages through military operations due to the harrowing conditions in Gaza: We survived on 250–300 calories a day for months

Title: How Trump tried to corner war-scarred Zelenskyy and extort Ukrain...

Title: Israel is Gazafiying the West Bank, and turning these Palestinian...

Description: Unlike in previous years, Passover does not coincide with the dates of Ramadan this year, reducing tensions. But, Israeli security forces remain concerned over potential terrorist attacks

Title: Israeli authorities on heightened alert as Islamic holy month, Ra...
Description: Unlike in previous years, Passover does not coincide with the dates of the Muslim holy month this year, so tensions surrounding Ramadan are lower than usual, however, there are concerns within Israel's security community about attempts by terror cells to carry out attacks within the country.

Title: Jury finds Illinois landlord guilty of murder, hate crime in 2023...

Title: On October 7, Israel's navy was only ready for a limited attack, ...
Description: Early that morning, a nearby naval base was told not to move its forces, an attempt to protect intelligence sources. Sixteen of 38 Hamas terrorists on boats entered Israel and killed 17 civilians

Title: BBC apologizes for Gaza documentary narrated by teenage son of Ha...
Description: The company that produced the documentary 'Gaza: How to Survive a War Zone' did not inform the BBC that the boy in the film is the son of a senior Hamas official who was paid for his participation. The BBC announced that the film will not be aired again

Title: The IDF's landmark Oct. 7 probes reveal only part of Israel's fai...
Description: The October 7 disaster wasn't just the result of mistaken decisions that night, but stemmed from years of failures. Chief among them: the political conception of Hamas as an Israeli asset, the intelligence misjudgment that it couldn't launch a large-scale attack, and weak defensive deployment

Title: IDF probe into Oct. 7 finds Southern Command dismissed Hamas inva...
Description: Investigations into Oct. 7 found that IDF commanders were unaware of battle locations and that troops were sent to cities instead of Gaza border communities. The Gaza Division also lacked intel for hours, yet its commander refused to report defeat

Title: IDF probe: Southern Command didn't think Hamas would invade, Gaza...
Description: Investigation into October 7 massacre found that commanders did not know what was happening or where battles were taking place - and troops were dispatched to the cities. Moreover, the Gaza Division couldn't provide intel for hours, but its commander refused to report it was defeated

Title: Years of Israeli misconceptions, intelligence blunders led to Oct...
Description: Israeli perceptions were deeply rooted – and no effort was made to challenge them': Investigations into Israel's threat assessments of Gaza and the intelligence community's performance reveal a series of political and military failures that resulted in the October 7 massacre

Title: IDF probe: Military Intelligence misread Hamas intentions, failed...
Description: Investigations into Israel's perception of the threat from Gaza and the performance of the intelligence community indicate that the October 7 massacre was preceded by a series of failures at the political and military levels. 'Israeli perceptions were deeply rooted – and no effort was made to challenge them'

Title: Israeli Air Force's attention was focused on Lebanon as Hamas inv...

Title: Israel's government wants a monopoly on cruelty to the hostages a...
Description: When an arm of Israel's government locks up a comedian for jokes about hostages, it is telling its citizens with chilling clarity that only we, lords of the land, are allowed to laugh at the hostages – and that we alone have the power to defile the dignity of the dead when it serves our interests

Title: Far-right rally calls for Israeli resettlement of Gaza, Palestini...

Title: Signs of life from underground: 24 living hostages remain in Gaza...
Description: Thirty-five of the hostages held by Hamas in Gaza have been declared dead. Signs of life have been received from most of the remaining 24 men. What do we know about how they were abducted, about their conditions in captivity, and who is waiting for them at home?

Title: We have no control over when Alon will return and how he'll retu...
Description: Nothing was known about Alon Ohel's fate until the latest group of hostages was released over the past several weeks. His younger brother, Ronen, says Alon's captivity is always with him. 'It's like the sun. You can't look at it all the time because it's blinding. But it's always there'

Title: Israel's Lapid proposes Egyptian 'guardianship' of postwar Gaza
Description: The Israeli opposition leader's plan would have Egypt rule Gaza for 8-15 years and allow for the PA's return to Gaza under certain conditions

Title: Rescued Israeli hostage Noa Argamani tells UN Security Council ho...
Description: Argamani spoke at the United Nations in New York and called for the cease-fire/hostage release deal to be implemented 'to end this tragedy'

Title: Arab Israeli standup comedian released from custody after telling...
Description: The police canceled two shows by Nidal Badarny, who had posted jokes online about hostages who had returned to Israel. Badarny said the cancellation was due to an 'incitement campaign against me by extremist racist groups'

Description: Channel 12's 'Uvda' program broadcast a segment in December alleging that Sara Netanyahu exchanged text messages with her husband's office manager asking that the employee take action against a witness in the prime minister's corruption trial, but the show's management refuses to provide its raw material, saying it could compromise its source

Title: Israel's state prosecutor slams police over raid on East Jerusale...
Description: The State Prosecutor's Office said the police failed to ask for the necessary approval to launch an incitement investigation before arresting the owners of the shop, which specializes in the history of the Israeli-Palestinian conflict

Title: Hassan Nasrallah may be dead, but at his funeral, Hezbollah showe...
Description: Israel tried, but only Lebanese actors can truly place Hezbollah in its grave. Here's why that's unlikely to happen

Title: Lebanese prime minister vows neutrality, says country will not be...
Description: We want a state that decides when there is war or peace. Our foreign policy will be neutral on Arab and international matters,' Nawaf Salam said in a parliamentary session

Title: 16 months after Oct. 7: Gaza border communities set to receive an...
Description: The Israeli army will start presenting its findings from the Oct. 7 investigations to communities near Gaza, as well as the families of the victims in the Nahal Oz military base and the Nova music festival. The main question remains – where was the army?

Title: To dodge court testimony, Netanyahu cynically exploits national s...
Description: Netanyahu repeatedly invokes 'matters related to ensuring our existence' to cut down his court appearances – despite being the one who insisted on staying in office, assuring both the court and the public that he could govern even with an indictment looming over him

Title: Oded Lifshitz, murdered in Gaza captivity, laid to rest in Nir Oz...
Description: Lifshitz, 83 at the time of his death, was one of the founders of Kibbutz Nir Oz ■ He was taken hostage by Islamic Jihad from his home on October 7 ■ His wife Yocheved said: 'We fought for peace all these years and we were struck a heavy blow by the very people we helped on the other side' ■ Israel's President Herzog: 'On behalf of the State of Israel, I ask for forgiveness'

Title: Hundreds gather in Nir Oz for funeral of Oded Lifshitz, murdered ...
Description: Lifshitz, 83 at the time of his death, was one of the founders of Kibbutz Nir Oz. He was taken hostage by Islamic Jihad from his home on October 7, and his body was returned on Thursday

Title: Jaffa theater petitions top court against police's banning films ...
Description: Riled by the blocking of 'Lyd' and 'Jenin, Jenin II,' the director of the Al Sayara Theater says the venue 'must not accept any entity with pretensions of being a self-appointed censor of artistic creativity'

Title: Court cancels Netanyahu's trial hearing after briefing from Israe...
Description: While the prime minister attempts to reduce his weekly time in court, his attorney requested that Netanyahu be brought in a staggering 24 more times, saying they aren't 'aren't willing to give up' on refuting all the prosecution's arguments

Title: Israeli academia faces hundreds of 'explicit' boycotts by foreign...
Description: A report released by Israel's Association of University Heads says that boycott attempts are increasingly coming from institutions rather than students, 'driven by political considerations.' Researchers' personal ties with overseas colleagues have also been affected

Title: Tusk force: This is how the Poles saved their democracy. Can Isra...
Description: Poland is a shining light for democracies that are coping with anti-liberal regimes. But can Israel find a skilled leader like Donald Tusk?
